control

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.Main

  • public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Main. It is called in startup and is the connection between the different software parts.

      • exit

        public void exit()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                 java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                 java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                 java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                 javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                 javax.crypto.ShortBufferException,
                 javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                 javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                 java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Exit. Toggled when close actions in any ways are performed. It iterates through the thread vector and waits for each process to cleanly finish before saving the actual state and closing the application.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the interrupted exception
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - the invalid key exception
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException - the no such provider exception
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - the no such padding exception
        javax.crypto.ShortBufferException - the short buffer exception
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - the illegal block size exception
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - the bad padding exception
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - the invalid algorithm parameter exception
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • tryLogin

        private void tryLogin(java.lang.String userName,
            java.lang.String userPassword)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                      java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                      javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                      javax.crypto.ShortBufferException,
                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                      java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Tries to perform a login with the given user data.
        Parameters:
        userName - the users name
        userPassword - the users password
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the interrupted exception
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - the invalid key exception
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException - the no such provider exception
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - the no such padding exception
        javax.crypto.ShortBufferException - the short buffer exception
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - the illegal block size exception
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - the bad padding exception
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - the invalid algorithm parameter exception

      • checkSynchronicity

        private void checkSynchronicity()
        Check synchronicity. Checks if all files stored in the file list are sill saved in the cloud.

      • startup

        private void startup()
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Startup. Called on program startup. Checks if there are saved configurations and users and determines if a account needs to be created or a login is possible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - the interrupted exception
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • toggle_MainWindow_fileSelected

        public void toggle_MainWindow_fileSelected(java.io.File selectedFile)
                                    throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                           java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                           javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Is called when a new file is selected to be added in the cloud.
        Parameters:
        selectedFile - A file object of the file to encrypt and upload.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - the invalid key exception
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - the no such algorithm exception
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException - the no such provider exception
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException - the no such padding exception
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - the invalid algorithm parameter exception

                        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException

        Parameters:
        args - the arguments
        Throws:
